etymology.description: 鼓浪 (beating/rousing waves) + 屿 (islet) = islet where waves drum.
etymology.interpretation: Named for the drum-like booming when waves strike shoreline rocks. Refers to the small island off Xiamen famed for its surf and scenery.
etymology.simplification: 嶼 was simplified to 屿 by dropping the mountain radical to reduce strokes; 鼓、浪 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 我们明天去鼓浪屿参观(我們明天去鼓浪嶼參觀)。
examples.english: We’re going to visit Gulangyu tomorrow.

examples.chinese: 鼓浪屿因钢琴文化和历史建筑闻名(鼓浪嶼因鋼琴文化和歷史建築聞名)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔlàngyǔ yīn gāngqín wénhuà hé lìshǐ jiànzhù wénmíng.
examples.english: Gulangyu is famous for its piano culture and historic architecture.

examples.chinese: 传说海浪拍打岩石会发出如鼓的声音，因此得名“鼓浪屿”(傳說海浪拍打岩石會發出如鼓的聲音，因此得名「鼓浪嶼」)。
examples.pinyin: Chuánshuō hǎilàng pāidǎ yánshí huì fāchū rú gǔ de shēngyīn, yīncǐ dé míng “Gǔlàngyǔ”.
examples.english: Legend says waves hitting the rocks make drum-like sounds, hence the name “Gulangyu.”
